item.title: 反人类的重定向流
item.description:
今天碰到一个非常烦人的重定向流语法案例，如下：

/usr/fengzhe/streams/redirect.py


import sys

class Output():
def __init__(self):
self.text = ''
def write(self, string):
self.text += string
def writelines(self, lines):
for line in lines: self.write(line)
class Input():
def __init__(self, input=''):
self.text = input
def read(self, size=None):
if size == None:
res, self.text = self.text, ''
else:
res, self.text = self.text[:size], self.text[size:]
return res
def readline(self):
eoln = self.text.find('\n')
if eoln == -1:
res, self.text = self.text, ''
else:
res, self.text = self.text[:eoln+1], self.text[eoln+1:]
return res

def redirect(function, pargs, kargs, input):
savestreams = sys.stdin, sys.stdout
sys.stdin = Input(input)
sys.stdout = Output()
try:
result = function(*pargs, *kargs)
output = sys.stdout.text
finally:
sys.stdin, sys.stdout = savestreams
return (result, output)


/usr/fengzhe/streams/teststreams
def interact():
print('Hello stream world')
while True:
try:
reply = input('Enter a number>')
except E0FError:
break
else:
num = int(reply)
print("%d squared is %d" % (num, num ** 2))
if __name__ == '__main__':
interact()

代码如上，试试执行以下命令：
from redirect import redirect
(result, output) = redirect(interact, (), {}, '4\n5\n6\n')
print(result)
output 输出结果是什么？跟你预想的是否一致？为什么？
